summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) regarding travel approval requests and logistical planning for the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It details multiple trips planned for 2019-2020 to conduct victim interviews in locations including West Palm Beach, Los Angeles, and Stockholm, Sweden.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Recipient of multiple travel approval and booking requests; appears to handle flight and hotel arrangements for the investigation team.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: The official who approves travel requests for the Epstein investigation team; sends approval emails.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on several travel request emails as part of the investigation team traveling for interviews.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Copied on a travel approval request email, indicating involvement in the investigation team.

connections.description: Tyrrell approves travel requests that Alleyne helps to coordinate and book.
Duncan is part of the team requesting travel approval from Tyrrell for the Epstein investigation.
Both are involved in the logistical and operational support for the investigation team's travel.

events.title: Planned Travel to Stockholm for Interview
events.description: Investigation team plans to travel from JFK to Stockholm, Sweden, with layovers in Paris, to conduct an interview.

events.title: Planned Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Team requests permission to travel to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) in connection with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Team requests permission to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview.

events.title: Planned Travel to West Palm Beach for Interview
events.description: Request for travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for an interview, with plans to reserve a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Travel to Los Angeles for Victim Interview
events.description: Request to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview, with plans to reserve a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Request to travel to West Palm Beach for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims.

events.title: Approved Travel to West Palm Beach for Investigation
events.description: Travel approved for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach for the case United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Initial request for travel to West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.

The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively conducting victim interviews in multiple cities (West Palm Beach, Los Angeles) and internationally (Stockholm) between 2019 and early 2020.

Travel requests emphasize cost-saving measures (refundable tickets, premium economy vs. regular economy, per diem hotel rates) and procedural compliance (domestic carrier preference, approval chains).
The investigation team routinely requested approval to reserve hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews during their travels.
The email chain shows a pattern of coordinated logistical planning between attorneys/investigators and administrative staff for evidence gathering in the Epstein case.
